author: thenecroscope
body:
Hi,

This is quiet a specific issue which is really geared to people using Dynamics AX 2012 R2 only. 

When I try to import the Microsoft Dynamics modules for 2012 R2. Some of the modules loaded ok (there are 3 in total) and some do not. The error I'm getting for Powershell 7 rc 3 is:
Could not load file Microsoft.Dynamics.Ax.Framework.Management

I'm blocked from using Powershell 7 until I can get to the bottom of this. Help! :)

thanks,

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: @thenecroscope The module is not in the repo. Please use other channels to communicate to Microsoft Dynamics team like UserVoice site

comments.author: thenecroscope
comments.body: Yup I understand that. I'm just flagging this as my understanding is that PS 7 aims to be backwards compatible with older modules. So it might a possible test case to investigate why this is not working. I wasn't really expecting answer to the question to be honest. Also 2012 R2 is out of support as well, so I think I'm stuck with the issue

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body:
> PS 7 aims to be backwards compatible with older modules. Not true for _binary_ modules. You could use WinCompat feature `Import-Module -UseWindowsPowerShell` See also https://devblogs.microsoft.com/powershell/announcing-powershell-7-0/
PowerShell
Announcing PowerShell 7.0 | PowerShell
Today, we’re happy to announce the Generally Available (GA) release of PowerShell 7.0! Before anything else, we’d like to thank our many, many open-source contributors for making this release possible by submitting code, tests, documentation, and issue feedback. PowerShell 7 would not have been possible without your help.

comments.author: thenecroscope
comments.body: Ah nice, I wasn't aware of that. Thanks

comments.author: msftbot[bot]
comments.body: This issue has been marked as external and has not had any activity for **1 day**. It has been be closed for housekeeping purposes.

title: Micrsoft Dynamics AX 2012 R2, Modules cannot be loaded on PS7 rx3
